deployment.author: aleido-svelte
deployment.message:
Fix: Resolve Entity Framework 6 connection string resolution in .NET Core
- Modified AdminDBEntity.Context.cs to inject IConfiguration for connection string lookup - Modified learnerDbEntity.Context.cs with configuration-based connection string support - Modified sadbEntity.Context.cs (superadmindbEntities) with configuration injection - Updated Program.cs to set static _configuration property on DbContext classes - Fixed App.Config with correct EDMX embedded resource names (DBEntity.AdminDBEntity, DbEntityLearner.learnerDbEntity, DBEntitySA.sadbEntity) - Corrected appsettings.Production.json connection string metadata paths to match actual embedded resource names
ROOT CAUSE: Entity Framework 6 auto-generated constructors used hardcoded 'name=contextName' references that don't work in .NET Core. Additionally, EDMX metadata paths were incorrect, preventing resource resolution.
SOLUTION: Implemented static configuration injection pattern allowing DbContexts to read connection strings from .NET Core IConfiguration system, with fallback to app.config naming convention.
This fix resolves the 500 Internal Server Error that was preventing application startup when deployed to Azure.
